The Signal

    What COVID-19 is doing to Brazil

    The poorest Brazilians are coming up with grassroots answers to COVID-19, even as the spread of the virus accelerates. So how is the pandemic changing their country?

    World Link: /news/world/

  1. 'Major incident' declared as thousands flock to UK beach despite pandemic Link: /news/2020-06-26/major-incident-declared-as-thousands-flock-to-uk-beach-heatwave/12394772?section=world

    Local authorities in the popular beachside town of Bournemouth urge people to leave the town after it became "stretched to the absolute hilt" during a second day of heatwave-like conditions as temperatures hit 33C.

  2. 'I will never forget this moment': Australia and New Zealand will host 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup Link: /news/2020-06-26/australia-and-new-zealand-to-host-2023-fifa-womens-world-cup/12394688

    The best female soccer players the world has to offer will be making the trip down under in 2023 as Australia and New Zealand win the right to host the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup.

  3. Chinese structures appear near border disputed with India Link: /news/2020-06-26/china-structures-built-on-india-border-ladakh-kashmir-dispute/12394664?section=world Link: /news/2020-06-26/china-structures-built-on-india-border-ladakh-kashmir-dispute/12394664

    There had been talk of tensions cooling on the China, India border but one week after 20 Indian troops were killed in fighting new satellite images show structures being built on the Chinese side, leaving India to verbally hit out.

  4. NASA simulation shows what sunsets might look like on other worlds Link: /news/2020-06-25/nasa-simulation-what-sunsets-look-like-on-other-planets-moons/12393672?section=world

    Animated videos of computer simulated sunsets show what the sky might look like if you were looking up through a super-wide camera lens from Venus, Mars, Uranus or Titan.

  5. Marathon vote on extending Vladimir Putin's rule in Russia begins Link: /news/2020-06-25/russia-vote-reform-extending-vladimir-putin-rule/12393792?section=world

    Russians will begin casting their ballots in a seven-day vote on sweeping reforms that could see President Vladimir Putin stay in the Kremlin until 2036, an exercise that critics call a constitutional coup.

  • Coronavirus update: US records its highest daily infection rise in two months Link: /news/2020-06-26/coronavirus-update-covid19/12394146

    The US records a one-day total of 34,700 new COVID-19 cases, the highest in two months, while scores of migrants arriving in Somalia are telling United Nations workers every day that they are unaware of COVID-19.

  • Trump 'an aberration' but the US global alliances may not survive a second term, says John Bolton Link: /news/2020-06-25/john-bolton-us-alliance-may-not-survive-second-donald-trump-term/12391056

    Donald Trump's former security adviser warns the United States' global relationships may not recover from the "damage" caused if President Donald Trump wins a second term.

  • Australia's coronavirus death toll rises after 'reclassification', while Sydney school closes due to positive test Link: /news/2020-06-25/sydney-school-closes-year-2-student-tests-positive-coronavirus/12390466

    The number of coronavirus fatalities in Australia climbs to 104 after an 85-year-old Sydney man's cause of death is reclassified, while a Year 2 student from a school on the lower north shore tests positive for COVID-19.

  • Analysis: Were Canberra's 13 light rail stations built in the right places? Link: /news/2020-06-25/are-canberra-light-rail-stations-in-the-right-locations/12382138

    After much lobbying by businesses in the area, the industrial suburb of Mitchell will soon have a tram stop. But very few people use the two stations that are closest to it.

  • When barrister Judith Fordham rejected a judge's advances, he punished her in court Link: /news/2020-06-25/wa-barrister-judith-fordham-recounts-indecent-assault-by-judge/12390076

    Prominent criminal barrister Judith Fordham reveals she was stalked by one judge and indecently assaulted by another, as a survey finds more than one in three WA lawyers have been sexually harassed.

    An escalating number of confirmed coronavirus infections in Victoria has resulted in Australia's biggest daily rise in cases in two months.

    A team of 800 health officials will aim to do 10,000 tests a day in a suburban testing blitz targeting 10 suburbs where there is a "community transmission challenge".

  • AFP investigates false claims Labor Eden Monaro by-election candidate infected with COVID-19 Link: /news/2020-06-25/afp-investigates-false-covid-claim-in-eden-monaro-by-election/12394270

    The Australian Federal Police is investigating an email which falsely claimed the Labor candidate for Eden Monaro had quit the by-election race after being testing positive to coronavirus.
